title: Haste
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                   |
| - | --------------------------------- |
|   | Speeds the actions of a creature. |

**Haste** is a status and a monster-only spell that increases the speed of all actions.

## Effect

[Hasted](/Status_effect#Haste "Status effect") entities have their actions take 2/3rds as long. This makes players and monsters alike significantly more dangerous, as acting more often makes them more effective at virtually everything they do.

Other than the spell, players and monsters can get this status via a [potion of haste](/Potion_of_haste "Potion of haste") or as a result of going [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk").

[Cheibriados](/Cheibriados "Cheibriados") hates the haste effect; unintentional hastes will be blocked, intentional hastes will result in [penance](/Penance "Penance").

## Monster Spell

The Haste spell gives the hasted status to its user.

The following enemies cast Haste:

- z [![Ancient champion.png](/images/8/81/Ancient_champion.png)](/File:Ancient_champion.png) **[Ancient champion](/Ancient_champion "Ancient champion")**
- L [![Ancient lich.png](/images/3/34/Ancient_lich.png)](/File:Ancient_lich.png) **[Ancient lich](/Ancient_lich "Ancient lich")**
- z [![Antique champion.png](/images/d/d7/Antique_champion.png)](/File:Antique_champion.png) **[Antique champion](/Antique_champion "Antique champion")**
- p [![Arcanist.png](/images/8/87/Arcanist.png)](/File:Arcanist.png) **[Arcanist](/Arcanist "Arcanist")**
- H [![Asterion.png](/images/7/71/Asterion.png)](/File:Asterion.png) **[Asterion](/Asterion "Asterion")**
- o [![Blork the orc.png](/images/d/d6/Blork_the_orc.png)](/File:Blork_the_orc.png) **[Blork the orc](/Blork_the_orc "Blork the orc")**
- & [![Cerebov.png](/images/c/c5/Cerebov.png)](/File:Cerebov.png) **[Cerebov](/Cerebov "Cerebov")**
- e [![Deep elf elementalist.png](/images/7/7b/Deep_elf_elementalist.png)](/File:Deep_elf_elementalist.png) **[Deep elf elementalist](/Deep_elf_elementalist "Deep elf elementalist")**
- e [![Deep elf knight.png](/images/1/19/Deep_elf_knight.png)](/File:Deep_elf_knight.png) **[Deep elf knight](/Deep_elf_knight "Deep elf knight")**
- e [![Deep elf sorcerer.png](/images/2/2b/Deep_elf_sorcerer.png)](/File:Deep_elf_sorcerer.png) **[Deep elf sorcerer](/Deep_elf_sorcerer "Deep elf sorcerer")**
- @ [![Donald.png](/images/6/6f/Donald.png)](/File:Donald.png) **[Donald](/Donald "Donald")**
- q [![Draconian knight.png](/images/a/a6/Draconian_knight.png)](/File:Draconian_knight.png) **[Draconian knight](/Draconian_knight "Draconian knight")**
- L [![Dread lich.png](/images/b/bc/Dread_lich.png)](/File:Dread_lich.png) **[Dread lich](/Dread_lich "Dread lich")**
- 1 [![Executioner.png](/images/9/93/Executioner.png)](/File:Executioner.png) **[Executioner](/Executioner "Executioner")**
- @ [![Frances.png](/images/8/83/Frances.png)](/File:Frances.png) **[Frances](/Frances "Frances")**
- p [![Hell knight.png](/images/4/4c/Hell_knight.png)](/File:Hell_knight.png) **[Hell knight](/Hell_knight "Hell knight")**
- @ [![Hellbinder.png](/images/0/08/Hellbinder.png)](/File:Hellbinder.png) **[Hellbinder](/Hellbinder "Hellbinder")**
- 1 [![Ignacio.png](/images/4/40/Ignacio.png)](/File:Ignacio.png) **[Ignacio](/Ignacio "Ignacio")**
- @ [![Jessica.png](/images/e/e8/Jessica.png)](/File:Jessica.png) **[Jessica](/Jessica "Jessica")**
- L [![Lich.png](/images/8/86/Lich.png)](/File:Lich.png) **[Lich](/Lich "Lich")**
- M [![Menkaure.png](/images/9/9d/Menkaure.png)](/File:Menkaure.png) **[Menkaure](/Menkaure "Menkaure")**
- N [![Naga mage.png](/images/2/23/Naga_mage.png)](/File:Naga_mage.png) **[Naga mage](/Naga_mage "Naga mage")**
- N [![Nagaraja.png](/images/b/b7/Nagaraja.png)](/File:Nagaraja.png) **[Nagaraja](/Nagaraja "Nagaraja")**
- c [![Nessos.png](/images/5/52/Nessos.png)](/File:Nessos.png) **[Nessos](/Nessos "Nessos")**
- i [![The Enchantress.png](/images/8/8f/The_Enchantress.png)](/File:The_Enchantress.png) **[The Enchantress](/The_Enchantress "The Enchantress")**
- V [![Vampire knight.png](/images/b/be/Vampire_knight.png)](/File:Vampire_knight.png) **[Vampire knight](/Vampire_knight "Vampire knight")**

The following enemies may be able to cast Haste, depending on their spell set:

- & [![Pandemonium lord.png](/images/c/c6/Pandemonium_lord.png)](/File:Pandemonium_lord.png) **[Pandemonium lord](/Pandemonium_lord "Pandemonium lord")** (7.5% chance)

A separate spell ([Haste Other](/Haste_Other "Haste Other")) allows monsters to give the haste status to other creatures. However, fairly few monsters possess it, and no monsters have both spells at once. The separation between the two monster spells and the resultant inability of [dread liches](/Dread_lich "Dread lich") and [deep elf sorcerers](/Deep_elf_sorcerer "Deep elf sorcerer") to haste their summons is more of an artifact of the way monster spellcasting is implemented than a mercy on the part of the developers.

## History

| [![Haste.png](/images/3/35/Haste.png)](/File:Haste.png) Haste |                                                                      |
| :------------------------------------------------------------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Level                                                         | 6                                                                    |
| School1                                                       | [Charms](/Charms "Charms")                                           |
| Source(s)                                                     | [Book of Enchantments](/Book_of_Enchantments "Book of Enchantments") |
| [Casting noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                   | 5                                                                    |
| [Spell noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                     | 0                                                                    |

- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), haste would cause [magic contamination](/Magic_contamination "Magic contamination") and [hunger](/Hunger "Hunger") over time. The [wand of hasting](/Wand_of_hasting "Wand of hasting") existed as another plentiful means of haste.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), Haste was a level 6 [Charms](/Charms "Charms") spell available to players; the player version allowed you to target either yourself or another creature, though players had to watch out for [magic contamination](/Magic_contamination "Magic contamination").
- Prior to [0.8](/0.8 "0.8"), Haste made all actions twice as fast.
- In very early versions of Crawl it was a level 8 spell: magic contamination did not yet exist, meaning that this spell could be spammed with no downsides other than food costs, so it merited being a higher level.
html:
Haste

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Speeds the actions of a creature.

Haste is a status and a monster-only spell that increases the speed of all actions.

Effect

Hasted entities have their actions take 2/3rds as long. This makes players and monsters alike significantly more dangerous, as acting more often makes them more effective at virtually everything they do.

Other than the spell, players and monsters can get this status via a potion of haste or as a result of going berserk.

Cheibriados hates the haste effect; unintentional hastes will be blocked, intentional hastes will result in penance.

Monster Spell

The Haste spell gives the hasted status to its user.

The following enemies cast Haste:

  • z Ancient champion
  • L Ancient lich
  • z Antique champion
  • p Arcanist
  • H Asterion
  • o Blork the orc
  • & Cerebov
  • e Deep elf elementalist
  • e Deep elf knight
  • e Deep elf sorcerer
  • @ Donald
  • q Draconian knight
  • L Dread lich
  • 1 Executioner
  • @ Frances
  • p Hell knight
  • @ Hellbinder
  • 1 Ignacio
  • @ Jessica
  • L Lich
  • M Menkaure
  • N Naga mage
  • N Nagaraja
  • c Nessos
  • i The Enchantress
  • V Vampire knight

The following enemies may be able to cast Haste, depending on their spell set:

  • & Pandemonium lord (7.5% chance)

A separate spell (Haste Other) allows monsters to give the haste status to other creatures. However, fairly few monsters possess it, and no monsters have both spells at once. The separation between the two monster spells and the resultant inability of dread liches and deep elf sorcerers to haste their summons is more of an artifact of the way monster spellcasting is implemented than a mercy on the part of the developers.

History

 Haste
Level 6
School1 Charms
Source(s) Book of Enchantments
Casting noise 5
Spell noise 0
  • Prior to 0.20, haste would cause magic contamination and hunger over time. The wand of hasting existed as another plentiful means of haste.
  • Prior to 0.19, Haste was a level 6 Charms spell available to players; the player version allowed you to target either yourself or another creature, though players had to watch out for magic contamination.
  • Prior to 0.8, Haste made all actions twice as fast.
  • In very early versions of Crawl it was a level 8 spell: magic contamination did not yet exist, meaning that this spell could be spammed with no downsides other than food costs, so it merited being a higher level.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Haste&oldid=72798"

rawPage:
{{version030}}
{{flavour|Speeds the actions of a creature.}}
'''Haste''' is a status and a monster-only spell that increases the speed of all actions. 

==Effect==
[[Status effect#Haste|Hasted]] entities have their actions take 2/3rds as long. This makes players and monsters alike significantly more dangerous, as acting more often makes them more effective at virtually everything they do.

Other than the spell, players and monsters can get this status via a [[potion of haste]] or as a result of going [[berserk]].

[[Cheibriados]] hates the haste effect; unintentional hastes will be blocked, intentional hastes will result in [[penance]].

==Monster Spell==
The Haste spell gives the hasted status to its user.

{{monsters with spell}}

A separate spell ([[Haste Other]]) allows monsters to give the haste status to other creatures. However, fairly few monsters possess it, and no monsters have both spells at once. The separation between the two monster spells and the resultant inability of [[dread lich]]es and [[deep elf sorcerer]]s to haste their summons is more of an artifact of the way monster spellcasting is implemented than a mercy on the part of the developers.

==History==
{{Spell
|name=Haste
|level=6
|school1={{Charms}}
|school2=
|school3=
|castingnoise=5
|spellnoise=0
|sources=[[Book of Enchantments]]
}}
*Prior to [[0.20]], haste would cause [[magic contamination]] and [[hunger]] over time. The [[wand of hasting]] existed as another plentiful means of haste.
*Prior to [[0.19]], Haste was a level 6 [[Charms]] spell available to players; the player version allowed you to target either yourself or another creature, though players had to watch out for [[magic contamination]].
*Prior to [[0.8]], Haste made all actions twice as fast.
*In very early versions of Crawl it was a level 8 spell: magic contamination did not yet exist, meaning that this spell could be spammed with no downsides other than food costs, so it merited being a higher level.
